intro: Beryllis pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean beryl, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to the cool, rocky environments of its habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native region.
